alert.note: Alert for Rio Arriba (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 6:49AM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Albuquerque NM has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Mexico... LOS PINOS RIVER at Ortiz affecting Rio Arriba County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Forecasts are not available for this location. Snowmelt is expected to cause the river to rise above flood stage and fluctuate. * WHERE...LOS PINOS RIVER at Ortiz. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flood waters will begin to innudate agricultural lands near the gage. Minor flooding along portions of Los Pinos Access Road will be possible. Low water crossings will become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 AM MDT Friday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.0 feet on 05/21/1973. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued this evening around 1000 PM MDT.
